Author: IamTrader#6042
Content: It says that the eth address that im going to deposit it to is not valid address

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: AtomicDEX mobile FAQ: https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000030788-atomicdex-faq

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Pinned a message.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@IamTrader atomicDEX uses mixed case addresses for ETH. they have error detection builtin
it seems like your exchange doesn't support mixed case addresses yet
you can simply convert all the alphabet to lower case and submit
convert to lower: <http://www.convertstring.com/StringFunction/ToLowerCase>
mixed case vs all lower: <https://metamask.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360015289992-Why-Some-Addresses-Are-Mixed-Case>
```
For example, address 0x6eaff3479c17b8e7a0069823dc87bab09fbf4549 is valid, but 0x6eAff3479c17b8e7A0069823DC87bAB09fBf4549 is easier to copy down safely.
```

Author: marktyler#0324
Content: Trying to withdraw btc. Says "error try again later"???

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @marktyler please ensure that you're using non segwit address as recepient, only p2pkh addresses are suported by protocol at the moment

Author: marktyler#0324
Content: The sending address starts with a "3" is there more to it?

Author: marktyler#0324
Content: Sorry i meant receiving address

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `3` or `bc1` thats segwit. Legacy addresses starting from `1` - you need to specify such address as a receiving address

Author: marktyler#0324
Content: So i need to use an address that starts with 1?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Yes, thats correct
